title: Prince Harry is 'bored' in California; does not see his friends anymore because...
content: ​Harry reportedly has a pre-Meghan and post-Meghan world and the two worlds do not merge. Harry was in England in May for the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games -- founded by Prince Harry -- but did not plan to see his friends as they are part of the pre-Meghan world which Harry hates to revisit. Harry's friends too do not reach out to the lonely prince because they feel betrayed by the way Harry wrote about his military service in his memoir 'Spare'.
summary: ​Harry reportedly has a pre-Meghan and post-Meghan world and the two worlds do not merge. Harry was in England in May for the 10th anniversary of the Invictus Games -- founded by Prince Harry -- but did not plan to see his friends as they are part of the pre-Meghan world which Harry hates to revisit. Harry's friends too do not reach out to the lonely prince because they feel betrayed by the way Harry wrote about his military service in his memoir 'Spare'.

title: Turnout in French elections on track to be highest in decades; 59.7% with 3 hours to go
Senior White House official from Obama administration wants Biden to withdraw: Report
content: A senior White House official, who has worked closely with President Biden, urges him not to seek reelection, citing concerns about his age and recent debate performance. Despite growing party pressure, Biden remains determined to continue his campaign. If reelected, he would be the oldest president in history. Multiple Democratic representatives and senators are advocating for his withdrawal.
summary: A senior White House official, who has worked closely with President Biden, urges him not to seek reelection, citing concerns about his age and recent debate performance. Despite growing party pressure, Biden remains determined to continue his campaign. If reelected, he would be the oldest president in history. Multiple Democratic representatives and senators are advocating for his withdrawal.

title: Biden hits campaign trail: US prez desperate to salvage reelection bid amid calls to withdraw from race
content: US President Joe Biden is campaigning to save his reelection bid amid calls from senior Democrats for him to withdraw. At 81, Biden plans campaign events in Pennsylvania before hosting the Nato summit. Facing scrutiny after a poor debate performance, Biden remains determined to defeat Trump again. Five Democratic lawmakers urge him to withdraw, but Biden insists on his capability to serve another term.
summary: US President Joe Biden is campaigning to save his reelection bid amid calls from senior Democrats for him to withdraw. At 81, Biden plans campaign events in Pennsylvania before hosting the Nato summit. Facing scrutiny after a poor debate performance, Biden remains determined to defeat Trump again. Five Democratic lawmakers urge him to withdraw, but Biden insists on his capability to serve another term.

title: 'Wonderful to say hello': Nasa crew emerge after year-long mars simulation
content: After a year-long simulated Mars mission, a Nasa crew emerged from their 17,000 sq ft habitat at Johnson Space Centre. The four-member team, part of the CHAPEA project, focused on simulated spacewalks, resource management, and maintaining health under Mars-like conditions. Their findings will aid future Mars missions. The project highlights the importance of sustainable living and global space exploration efforts.
summary: After a year-long simulated Mars mission, a Nasa crew emerged from their 17,000 sq ft habitat at Johnson Space Centre. The four-member team, part of the CHAPEA project, focused on simulated spacewalks, resource management, and maintaining health under Mars-like conditions. Their findings will aid future Mars missions. The project highlights the importance of sustainable living and global space exploration efforts.

title: 'Every single person not named Biden...': Democrats feel sh*t is going to hit fan
content: ​Joe Biden said he will opt out of the presidential race only if the Almighty Lord tells him to do so but the Democrats, as reported by Axios, want a more earthly intervention to 'beg' Biden to drop out by this Friday. A top Democratic operative said every single person not named Biden or paid by the president knows how a deep hole he's in.
summary: ​Joe Biden said he will opt out of the presidential race only if the Almighty Lord tells him to do so but the Democrats, as reported by Axios, want a more earthly intervention to 'beg' Biden to drop out by this Friday. A top Democratic operative said every single person not named Biden or paid by the president knows how a deep hole he's in.

title: Iran's naval destroyer Sahand capsizes and sinks: State media
Why Kamala Harris is not speaking about Biden
content: ​During the conversation, Harris said US election 2024 is probably the most significant election of the lifetime. Donald Trump openly declared that his intention is to be a dictator from day one if he is re-elected, Kamala Harris said positioning the election topic towards Trump, and not Biden. “People voted in record numbers in 2020. This is what was able to happen, and when everyone votes in those numbers again in 122 days, we can see it through,” Harris said.
summary: ​During the conversation, Harris said US election 2024 is probably the most significant election of the lifetime. Donald Trump openly declared that his intention is to be a dictator from day one if he is re-elected, Kamala Harris said positioning the election topic towards Trump, and not Biden. “People voted in record numbers in 2020. This is what was able to happen, and when everyone votes in those numbers again in 122 days, we can see it through,” Harris said.

title: Kuwait visa rules: Domestic workers can now transfer to private sector
content: ​Expats working in domestic sectors in Kuwait now can transfer their visa to private sector, according to the new visa rules introduced by the Kuwait government. The Office of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence and Interior Sheikh Fahad Al Yousuf Al Sabah said the decision is aimed at streamlining the transfer process adhering to the country's legal framework for labor mobility.
summary: ​Expats working in domestic sectors in Kuwait now can transfer their visa to private sector, according to the new visa rules introduced by the Kuwait government. The Office of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Defence and Interior Sheikh Fahad Al Yousuf Al Sabah said the decision is aimed at streamlining the transfer process adhering to the country's legal framework for labor mobility.

title: California dad's grocery list goes viral: 'What it takes to feed six kids'
content: ​A father of six posted a video of the receipt of the grocery items and other food items that he bought from Trader Joe's amounting to a whopping $444. "Here's what it takes to feed six kids about a week and a half," the dad of six said as he showed the social media users the long list. Most of the items on the list const between $2.99 and $3.99 but the total bill came to $444 as there were many things on the list.
summary: ​A father of six posted a video of the receipt of the grocery items and other food items that he bought from Trader Joe's amounting to a whopping $444. "Here's what it takes to feed six kids about a week and a half," the dad of six said as he showed the social media users the long list. Most of the items on the list const between $2.99 and $3.99 but the total bill came to $444 as there were many things on the list.

Beryl bears down on Texas, where it is expected to hit after regaining hurricane strength
content: Hurricane Beryl, currently 330 miles southeast of Corpus Christi, will hit Texas Monday with 60 mph winds. Dan Patrick declared a disaster in 121 counties, with Refugio County's 6,700 residents evacuating. Fourth of July tourists are advised to leave Baffin Bay to Sargent. Mitch Thames emphasizes safety. Heavy rain and strong winds are anticipated, per Jack Beven.
summary: Hurricane Beryl, currently 330 miles southeast of Corpus Christi, will hit Texas Monday with 60 mph winds. Dan Patrick declared a disaster in 121 counties, with Refugio County's 6,700 residents evacuating. Fourth of July tourists are advised to leave Baffin Bay to Sargent. Mitch Thames emphasizes safety. Heavy rain and strong winds are anticipated, per Jack Beven.

title: Amtrak service between New York City and Boston restored after lightning causes malfunction
Sri Lanka to lift ban on foreign research vessels despite India's concerns
State of emergency declared in Russia's Voronezh region after Ukraine drone attack
content: A state of emergency was announced in parts of Russia's Voronezh region due to a warehouse fire ignited by a Ukrainian drone attack. No casualties reported, but ongoing risks remain. Air defense systems destroyed several drones, leading to the fire. Both Russia and Ukraine have been utilizing drones extensively since February 2022.
summary: A state of emergency was announced in parts of Russia's Voronezh region due to a warehouse fire ignited by a Ukrainian drone attack. No casualties reported, but ongoing risks remain. Air defense systems destroyed several drones, leading to the fire. Both Russia and Ukraine have been utilizing drones extensively since February 2022.

title: 14 killed, 9 missing after heavy rains trigger landslides in Nepal
content: Recent heavy rains have led to flash floods and landslides in Nepal and India, causing casualties and displacements. Climate change and increased road construction are cited as contributing factors. Authorities are working to locate missing individuals and provide assistance to affected regions.
summary: Recent heavy rains have led to flash floods and landslides in Nepal and India, causing casualties and displacements. Climate change and increased road construction are cited as contributing factors. Authorities are working to locate missing individuals and provide assistance to affected regions.

title: France's second round of elections: Far-right win or a hung parliament?
content: In the second round of the French parliamentary elections, voting commenced with the far-right National Rally aiming to strengthen its position, while President Emmanuel Macron's Renaissance party seeks a comeback. Following a significant first-round victory for Marine Le Pen's RN, polling indicates a potential shift in parliament's balance, with Macron's coalition and leftist forces aligning against the RN. If RN secures a majority, Jordan Bardella could become prime minister, potentially reshaping policies on immigration and Euroscepticism.
summary: In the second round of the French parliamentary elections, voting commenced with the far-right National Rally aiming to strengthen its position, while President Emmanuel Macron's Renaissance party seeks a comeback. Following a significant first-round victory for Marine Le Pen's RN, polling indicates a potential shift in parliament's balance, with Macron's coalition and leftist forces aligning against the RN. If RN secures a majority, Jordan Bardella could become prime minister, potentially reshaping policies on immigration and Euroscepticism.
